title: Seneca Polytechnic launches its first-ever master’s degree - a program in AI
description: TORONTO, Sept. 19, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Seneca Polytechnic is now offering its first-ever master’s degree with the introduction of the new Master of Artificial Intelligence Design & Development program. Combining an innovative, industry-focused curriculum with hands-on, work-integrated learning, the program will prepare graduates for high-demand careers. The new program was announced on Seneca’s website on September 12, 2025.

title: Pet Smart Collar Provides Real-Time Health Data
description: A new smart collar, called the PetPace V3.0, uses artificial intelligence to track vital signs of dogs and cats and relay them directly to licensed veterinarians.
content: A new smart collar is giving pet parents a powerful way to monitor their pets’ health — and even consult veterinarians through telehealth. The PetPace V3.0 collar uses artificial intelligence to track vital signs and relay them directly to licensed v... [1649 chars]

title: Turning materials data into AI-powered lab assistants
description: As the volume of scientific literature continues to grow, researchers are turning to artificial intelligence to sift through millions of research papers and uncover insights that can accelerate the discovery of new materials.

title: Italy Passes Groundbreaking AI Law Targeting Criminals Who Make Deepfakes
description: Italy has enacted the European Union’s first national law specifically regulating artificial intelligence, setting penalties and safeguards.
content:
Italy has enacted the European Union’s first national law specifically regulating artificial intelligence, setting penalties and safeguards intended to curb misuse while encouraging innovation.

title: bomb era offers lessons for the AI bubble

title: ‘Almost every instructor is doing it’: How university professors are using AI, and why students are concerned
description: Students who spoke to CNA TODAY said that they accept the use of artificial intelligence tools for course preparation if professors are transparent, but oppose using it for grading.
content:
In response to CNA TODAY's queries, all six autonomous universities in Singapore said that they viewed artificial intelligence (AI) as a useful and transformative pedagogical tool that requires responsible use.
